dewTxÂ¶

>>> from phasepy import component, mixture, prsveos
>>> from phasepy.equilibrium import dewTx
>>> ethanol = component(name = 'ethanol', Tc = 514.0, Pc = 61.37, Zc = 0.241, Vc = 168.0, w = 0.643558,
...                ksv = [1.27092923, 0.0440421],
...                GC = {'CH3':1, 'CH2':1, 'OH(P)':1})
>>> mtbe = component(name = 'mtbe', Tc = 497.1, Pc = 34.3, Zc = 0.273, Vc = 329.0, w = 0.266059,
...               ksv = [0.76429651, 0.04242646],
...                GC = {'CH3':3, 'CH3O':1, 'C':1})
>>> mix = mixture(mtbe, ethanol)
>>> C0 = np.array([ 0.02635196, -0.02855964,  0.01592515])
>>> C1 = np.array([312.575789  ,  50.1476555 ,   5.13981131])
>>> mix.rk(C0, C1)
>>> eos = prsveos(mix, mixrule = 'mhv_rk')
>>> y = np.array([0.5,0.5])
>>> P = 1 #K
>>> x0 = np.array([0.2,0.8])
>>> T0 = 340
>>> dewTx( x0, T0, y, P , eos)
>>> # x, T
array([0.19854812, 0.80145188]), 338.85030223879545
dewTx(x_guess, T_guess, y, P, model, good_initial=False, v0=[None, None], full_output=False)[source]Â¶

Dew point (T, y) -> (P, y)

Solves dew point at given vapour composition and pressure. It uses a combination of accelerated successive sustitution with quasi Newton Method in regular cases and when good initial itâs provided the full system of equations of the phase envelope method is used as objective function.

Parameters:
  • x_guess (array_like) â guess of liquid phase composition
  • T_guess (float) â guess of equilibrium temperature of the liquid in K.
  • y (array_like) â vapour phase composition
  • P (float) â pressure of the liquid in bar
  • model (object) â create from mixture, eos and mixrule
  • good_initial (bool, optional) â if True skip sucesive sustitution and solves by Newtonâs Method.
  • v0 (list, optional) â if supplied volume used as initial value to compute fugacities
  • full_output (bool, optional) â wheter to outputs all calculation info
Returns:

  • X (array_like) â liquid mole fraction vector
  • T (float) â equilibrium temperature in K
